title:
Intrinsic Thermo-Spintronic Response of Superconducting Quasiparticles:
  Berry Curvature Effects
authors: Zhen-Cheng Liao, Cong Xiao, Zhi Wang and Qian Niu
abstract:
We propose two thermo-spintronic responses of spin-orbit coupled
superconductors - the intrinsic thermal Edelstein effect and intrinsic spin
Nernst effect - stemming from phase-space and momentum-space Berry curvatures
of Bogoliubov quasiparticles. We unveil that the Bloch band spin-orbit coupling
and superconducting pairing are entangled in shaping the quasiparticle Berry
curvatures rather than in an additive manner. The resulting thermo-spintronic
responses are significantly enhanced at low temperatures by the emergence of
Bogoliubov Fermi surface, and can be effectively modulated by tuning the
latter. Our work reveals unique Berry curvature properties in topologically
trivial superconductors with spin-orbit coupling, and opens a new route to
superconducting spintronics.
